IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Detention Watch Network is a national coalition building power through collective advocacy, grassroots organizing, and strategic communications to abolish immigration detention in the United States.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Detention Watch Network is a national coalition building power through collective advocacy, grassroots organizing, and strategic communications to abolish immigration detention in the United States.
IRS990.Desc: Detention Watch Network imagines a world where every individual lives and moves freely and a society in which racial equity is the norm and immigration is not criminalized. The abolition of immigration detention is part and parcel of struggles against racism, xenophobia, discriminatory policing, and mass incarceration and our aims coincide with these broader struggles against racialized oppression.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Detention Watch Network is exempt from federal income tax as a nonprofit organization described in Section 501(c)(3). Detention Watch Network did not have a liability for unrelated business income taxes for the year ended December 31, 2022.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Centro de Trabajadores Unidos United Workers' Center
Mexican American Legal Defense and Educational Fund
Minnesota Interfaith Coalition on Immigration ICOM
Northwest Alliance for Alternative Media & Education Portland Alliance
St Louis Inter-Faith Committee on Latin America

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization requires reports describing the accomplishments obtained with the funding.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The board of directors review the Form 990 before it is filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy is reviewed annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The executive director reports to the board of directors and is evaluated on an annual basis. The process for determining compensation includes a review of comparable data and the performance of the executive director.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Organizing documents are available to the public upon request.
The Organization has a finance committee that oversees the selection of the independent auditor and the outside accountants.
